file_content.text: Whatever else happens, at least the Republic won't get their hands on those high yield bombs.
Your loose weapons are secured, lieutenant.
I recovered the bombs.
Who knows what damage the Republic could've done with those?
Let's hope we never learn the answer to that.
Thankfully we'll never know.
I couldn't agree more.
Just doing my duty.
If you're done talking, we have a deal to finish up.
Whatever. Pay me.
Of course, you're right. Small talk's overrated.
Your unit's failure to recover these weapons is inexcusable. You will request a demotion and change of unit immediately, or you'll answer to me.
And the blame would be yours.
Yes... of course. I'll speak to my battalion commander right away.
Long live the Emperor.
We need to secure those bombs before the Republic's recovery teams get to them.
My lord! Please--a minute of your time.
Sir! Requesting assistance, sir.
Good! They said you were in the area.
The name's Ogden, munitions recovery--Lord Karvus's unit. Well... it was. Lord Karvus is dead. Everyone is.
We were recovering a load of advanced munitions from a downed weapons transport when we got ambushed. Seems the Republic wants those bombs too.
The Empire does not arm its enemies. You'd better have a plan.
That must not happen.
Yes, my lord. That's why I need help. We must recover those bombs--now.
No doubt they'll be salivating at the thought of obtaining Imperial weapons technology.
You can be sure they'll try.
Yes, my lord. We can't let that happen.
Sounds dangerous. Solving this problem's probably worth a few credits.
I smell an opportunity.
Pay is no problem. I'll get approval from battalion command.
You said "advanced munitions." How sensitive are these weapons?
How big a threat is this?
As sensitive as they get.
Tell me about the crash site.
Where are the bombs?
The impact zone's an upscale apartment block. We know the bombs survived because the area isn't one big smoking crater.
Recovery teams are supposed to be elite units.
Explain this failure.
We got ambushed. The Republic knows how important those munitions are.
The bombs are new generation high yield incendiaries. Expanded blast radius. Bigger than anything the Republic has on Corellia.
In Republic hands they'd do massive damage to our ground units. And we found out the hard way they've already got units in the area.
I can recover those bombs before the Republic can. Leave it to me.
I'll get to them first.
Be careful. They've got snipers and spotters holding territory. Probably waiting for their own recovery teams to come in after the bombs.
You'll have to take them out first.
I need to know what the opposition is.
What units?
Well that's just great.
Believe me, I know how bad it is. I carried back a lot of dog tags.
Special Republic recon units are on-site. Snipers and spotters. I know this scum--they're the advance team for the bomb unit.
You'll have to take them out first. But they're good--it took them less than a minute to cut down Lord Karvus and the others.
A lesson for you, lieutenant--watch and learn how a true Sith handles Republic scum.
I'll get the bombs.
Yes, my lord. I'm looking forward to it.
They are about to face a new kind of foe--one who does not fall so easily.
I'll get the bombs.
Thank you, my lord.
A simple trade. I get your bombs. You reward me ever-so-handsomely.
You've got a deal.
As handsomely as I can, sir.
These weapons are staying in Imperial hands. I guarantee it.
I'll get the bombs.
Thank you, sir. I was hoping you'd see the urgency of this mess.
Snipers, huh? Whatever.
I guess I heard right about you, then. Good luck.
I'll tell my battalion commander you're going in.
Not interested. [Refuse Quest]
Please tell me if you reconsider. We can't let the Republic get those bombs!
I'm trying to deal with a crisis. Please excuse me.
